children.name: Kouta
children.description: Kouta, which literally means "little" or "short" song, is one type of the many varieties of Japanese folk songs that is distinguished by its briefness and wittiness.

children.name: Ondō
children.description: Originally referred to the type of call-and-response form of Gagaku, but later became to be known for and distinguished by a swung 2/2 rhythm and storytelling.

children.name: Tsugaru shamisen
